013package org.apache.juneau.rest.logger;
014
015import static java.util.logging.Level.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.Enablement.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ObjectUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.internal.SystemEnv.*;
022import static org.apache.juneau.rest.logger.CallLoggingDetail.*;
023
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.function.*;
026import java.util.logging.*;
027
028import javax.servlet.http.*;
029
030import org.apache.juneau.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.rest.stats.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.rest.util.*;
036
037/**
038 * Basic implementation of a {@link CallLogger} for logging HTTP requests.
039 *
040 * <p>
041 * Provides the following capabilities:
042 * <ul>
043 *    <li>Allows incoming HTTP requests to be logged at various {@link Enablement detail levels}.
044 *    <li>Allows rules to be defined to handle request logging differently depending on the resulting status code.
045 *    <li>Allows use of stack trace hashing to eliminate duplication of stack traces in log files.
046 *    <li>Allows customization of handling of where requests are logged to.
047 *    <li>Allows configuration via system properties or environment variables.
048 * </ul>
049 *
050 * <p>
051 * The following is an example of a logger that logs errors only when debugging is not enabled, and everything when
052 * logging is enabled.
053 *
054 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
055 * <p class='bjava'>
056 *       CallLogger <jv>logger</jv> = CallLogger
057 *          .<jsm>create</jsm>()
058 *          .logger(<js>"MyLogger"</js>)  <jc>// Use MyLogger Java logger.</jc>
059 *          .normalRules(  <jc>// Rules when debugging is not enabled.</jc>
060 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log 500+ errors with status-line and header information.</jc>
061 *                .statusFilter(x -&gt; x &gt;= 500)
062 *                .level(<jsf>SEVERE</jsf>)
063 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>HEADER</jsf>)
064 *                .responseDetail<jsf>(HEADER</jsf>)
065 *                .build(),
066 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log 400-500 errors with just status-line information.</jc>
067 *                .statusFilter(x -&gt; x &gt;= 400)
068 *                .level(<jsf>WARNING</jsf>)
069 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>STATUS_LINE</jsf>)
070 *                .responseDetail(<jsf>STATUS_LINE</jsf>)
071 *                .build()
072 *          )
073 *          .debugRules(  <jc>// Rules when debugging is enabled.</jc>
074 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log everything with full details.</jc>
075 *                .level(<jsf>SEVERE</jsf>)
076 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>ENTITY</jsf>)
077 *                .responseDetail(<jsf>ENTITY</jsf>)
078 *                .build()
079 *          )
080 *          .build()
081 *       ;
082 * </p>
083 *
084 * <ul class='seealso'>
085 *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#callLogger()}
086 *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#debugEnablement()}
087 *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#debug}
088 *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#debug}
089 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server.jrs.LoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
090 * </ul>
091 */
092public class CallLogger {
093
094   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
095   // Static
096   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
097
098   private static final CallLoggerRule DEFAULT_RULE = CallLoggerRule.create(BeanStore.INSTANCE).build();
099
100   /** Represents no logger */
101   public abstract class Void extends CallLogger {
102      Void(BeanStore beanStore) {
103         super(beanStore);
104      }
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * System property name for the default logger name to use for {@link CallLogger} objects.
109    * <p>
110    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER</c> environment variable.
111    * <p>
112    * If not specified, the default is <js>"global"</js>.
113    */
114   public static final String SP_logger = "juneau.restLogger.logger";
115
116   /**
117    * System property name for the default enablement setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
118    * <p>
119    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_ENABLED</c> environment variable.
120    * <p>
121    * The possible values are:
122    * <ul>
123    *    <li>{@link Enablement#ALWAYS "ALWAYS"} (default) - Logging is enabled.
124    *    <li>{@link Enablement#NEVER "NEVER"} - Logging is disabled.
125    *    <li>{@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL "CONDITIONALLY"} - Logging is enabled if it passes the {@link Builder#enabledTest(Predicate)} test.
126    * </ul>
127    */
128   public static final String SP_enabled = "juneau.restLogger.enabled";
129
130   /**
131    * System property name for the default request detail setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
132    * <p>
133    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_REQUESTDETAIL</c> environment variable.
134    *
135    * <ul class='values'>
136    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE "STATUS_LINE"} (default) - Log only the status line.
137    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER "HEADER"} - Log the status line and headers.
138    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY "ENTITY"} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
139    * </ul>
140    */
141   public static final String SP_requestDetail = "juneau.restLogger.requestDetail";
142
143   /**
144    * System property name for the default response detail setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
145    * <p>
146    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_RESPONSEDETAIL</c> environment variable.
147    *
148    * <ul class='values'>
149    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE "STATUS_LINE"} (default) - Log only the status line.
150    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER "HEADER"} - Log the status line and headers.
151    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY "ENTITY"} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
152    * </ul>
153    */
154   public static final String SP_responseDetail = "juneau.restLogger.responseDetail";
155
156   /**
157    * System property name for the logging level setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
158    * <p>
159    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LEVEL</c> environment variable.
160    *
161    * <ul class='values'>
162    *    <li>{@link Level#OFF "OFF"} (default)
163    *    <li>{@link Level#SEVERE "SEVERE"}
164    *    <li>{@link Level#WARNING "WARNING"}
165    *    <li>{@link Level#INFO "INFO"}
166    *    <li>{@link Level#CONFIG "CONFIG"}
167    *    <li>{@link Level#FINE "FINE"}
168    *    <li>{@link Level#FINER "FINER"}
169    *    <li>{@link Level#FINEST "FINEST"}
170    * </ul>
171    */
172   public static final String SP_level = "juneau.restLogger.level";
173
174   /**
175    * Static creator.
176    *
177    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
178    * @return A new builder for this object.
179    */
180   public static Builder create(BeanStore beanStore) {
181      return new Builder(beanStore);
182   }
183
184   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
185   // Builder
186   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
187
188   /**
189    * Builder class.
190    */
191   @FluentSetters
192   public static class Builder {
193
194      Logger logger;
195      ThrownStore thrownStore;
196      List<CallLoggerRule> normalRules = list(), debugRules = list();
197      Enablement enabled;
198      Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest;
199      CallLoggingDetail requestDetail, responseDetail;
200      Level level;
201
202      /**
203       * Constructor.
204       *
205       * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
206       */
207      protected Builder(BeanStore beanStore) {
208         logger = Logger.getLogger(env(SP_logger, "global"));
209         enabled = env(SP_enabled, ALWAYS);
210         enabledTest = x -> false;
211         requestDetail = env(SP_requestDetail, STATUS_LINE);
212         responseDetail = env(SP_responseDetail, STATUS_LINE);
213         level = env(SP_level).map(Level::parse).orElse(OFF);
214      }
215
216      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
217      // Properties
218      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
219
220      /**
221       * Specifies the logger to use for logging the request.
222       *
223       * <p>
224       * If not specified, the logger name is determined in the following order:
225       * <ol>
226       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "juneau.restLogger.logger"} system property.
227       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER"} environment variable.
228       *    <li><js>"global"</js>.
229       * </ol>
230       *
231       * <p>
232       * The {@link CallLogger#getLogger()} method can also be overridden to provide different logic.
233       *
234       * @param value
235       *    The logger to use for logging the request.
236       * @return This object.
237       */
238      public Builder logger(Logger value) {
239         logger = value;
240         return this;
241      }
242
243      /**
244       * Specifies the logger to use for logging the request.
245       *
246       * <p>
247       * Shortcut for calling <c>logger(Logger.<jsm>getLogger</jsm>(value))</c>.
248       *
249       * <p>
250       * If not specified, the logger name is determined in the following order:
251       * <ol>
252       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "juneau.restLogger.logger"} system property.
253       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER"} environment variable.
254       *    <li><js>"global"</js>.
255       * </ol>
256       *
257       * <p>
258       * The {@link CallLogger#getLogger()} method can also be overridden to provide different logic.
259       *
260       * @param value
261       *    The logger to use for logging the request.
262       * @return This object.
263       */
264      public Builder logger(String value) {
265         logger = value == null ? null :Logger.getLogger(value);
266         return this;
267      }
268
269      /**
270       * Same as {@link #logger(Logger)} but only sets the value if it's currently <jk>null</jk>.
271       *
272       * @param value The logger to use for logging the request.
273       * @return This object.
274       */
275      public Builder loggerOnce(Logger value) {
276         if (logger == null)
277            logger = value;
278         return this;
279      }
280
281      /**
282       * Specifies the thrown exception store to use for getting stack trace information (hash IDs and occurrence counts).
283       *
284       * @param value
285       *    The stack trace store.
286       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, stack trace information will not be logged.
287       * @return This object.
288       */
289      public Builder thrownStore(ThrownStore value) {
290         thrownStore = value;
291         return this;
292      }
293
294      /**
295       * Same as {@link #thrownStore(ThrownStore)} but only sets the value if it's currently <jk>null</jk>.
296       *
297       * @param value
298       *    The stack trace store.
299       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, stack trace information will not be logged.
300       * @return This object.
301       */
302      public Builder thrownStoreOnce(ThrownStore value) {
303         if (thrownStore == null)
304            thrownStore = value;
305         return this;
306      }
307      /**
308       * Specifies the default logging enablement setting.
309       *
310       * <p>
311       * This specifies the default logging enablement value if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
312       *
313       * <p>
314       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
315       * <ul>
316       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_enabled "juneau.restLogger.enabled"} system property.
317       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_enabled "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_ENABLED"} environment variable.
318       *    <li><js>"ALWAYS"</js>.
319       * </ul>
320       *
321       * <ul class='values'>
322       *    <li>{@link Enablement#ALWAYS ALWAYS} (default) - Logging is enabled.
323       *    <li>{@link Enablement#NEVER NEVER} - Logging is disabled.
324       *    <li>{@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL CONDITIONALLY} - Logging is enabled if it passes the {@link #enabledTest(Predicate)} test.
325       * </ul>
326       *
327       * <p>
328       * @param value
329       *    The default enablement flag value.  Can be <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
330       * @return This object.
331       */
332      public Builder enabled(Enablement value) {
333         enabled = value;
334         return this;
335      }
336
337      /**
338       * Specifies the default logging enablement test predicate.
339       *
340       * <p>
341       * This specifies the default logging enablement test if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
342       *
343       * <p>
344       * This setting has no effect if the enablement setting is not {@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL CONDITIONALLY}.
345       *
346       * <p>
347       * The default if not specified is <c><jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jk>false</jk></c> (never log).
348       *
349       * @param value
350       *    The default enablement flag value.  Can be <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
351       * @return This object.
352       */
353      public Builder enabledTest(Predicate<HttpServletRequest> value) {
354         enabledTest = value;
355         return this;
356      }
357
358      /**
359       * Shortcut for calling <c>enabled(<jsf>NEVER</jsf>)</c>.
360       *
361       * @return This object.
362       */
363      public Builder disabled() {
364         return enabled(NEVER);
365      }
366
367      /**
368       * The default level of detail to log on a request.
369       *
370       * <p>
371       * This specifies the default level of request detail if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
372       *
373       * <p>
374       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
375       * <ul>
376       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_requestDetail "juneau.restLogger.requestDetail"} system property.
377       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_requestDetail "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_requestDetail"} environment variable.
378       *    <li><js>"STATUS_LINE"</js>.
379       * </ul>
380       *
381       * <ul class='values'>
382       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE STATUS_LINE} - Log only the status line.
383       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER HEADER} - Log the status line and headers.
384       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY ENTITY} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
385       * </ul>
386       *
387       * @param value
388       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
389       * @return This object.
390       */
391      public Builder requestDetail(CallLoggingDetail value) {
392         requestDetail = value;
393         return this;
394      }
395
396      /**
397       * The default level of detail to log on a response.
398       *
399       * <p>
400       * This specifies the default level of response detail if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
401       *
402       * <p>
403       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
404       * <ul>
405       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_responseDetail "juneau.restLogger.responseDetail"} system property.
406       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_responseDetail "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_responseDetail"} environment variable.
407       *    <li><js>"STATUS_LINE"</js>.
408       * </ul>
409       *
410       * <ul class='values'>
411       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE STATUS_LINE} - Log only the status line.
412       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER HEADER} - Log the status line and headers.
413       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY ENTITY} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
414       * </ul>
415       *
416       * @param value
417       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
418       * @return This object.
419       */
420      public Builder responseDetail(CallLoggingDetail value) {
421         responseDetail = value;
422         return this;
423      }
424
425      /**
426       * The default logging level to use for logging the request/response.
427       *
428       * <p>
429       * This specifies the default logging level if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
430       *
431       * <p>
432       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
433       * <ul>
434       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_level "juneau.restLogger.level"} system property.
435       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_level "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_level"} environment variable.
436       *    <li><js>"OFF"</js>.
437       * </ul>
438       *
439       * @param value
440       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default value.
441       * @return This object.
442       */
443      public Builder level(Level value) {
444         level = value;
445         return this;
446      }
447
448      /**
449       * Adds logging rules to use when debug mode is not enabled.
450       *
451       * <p>
452       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
453       *
454       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
455       * @return This object.
456       */
457      public Builder normalRules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
458         for (CallLoggerRule rule : values)
459            normalRules.add(rule);
460         return this;
461      }
462
463      /**
464       * Adds logging rules to use when debug mode is enabled.
465       *
466       * <p>
467       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
468       *
469       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
470       * @return This object.
471       */
472      public Builder debugRules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
473         for (CallLoggerRule rule : values)
474            debugRules.add(rule);
475         return this;
476      }
477
478      /**
479       * Shortcut for adding the same rules as normal and debug rules.
480       *
481       * <p>
482       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
483       *
484       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
485       * @return This object.
486       */
487      public Builder rules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
488         return normalRules(values).debugRules(values);
489      }
490
491      /**
492       * Instantiates a new call logger based on the settings in this builder.
493       *
494       * @return A new call logger.
495       */
496      public CallLogger build() {
497         return new CallLogger(this);
498      }
499
500      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
501      // Fluent setters
502      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
503
504      // <FluentSetters>
505
506      // </FluentSetters>
507   }
508
509   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
510   // Instance
511   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
512
513   private final Logger logger;
514   private final ThrownStore thrownStore;
515   private final CallLoggerRule[] normalRules, debugRules;
516   private final Enablement enabled;
517   private final Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest;
518   private final Level level;
519   private final CallLoggingDetail requestDetail, responseDetail;
520
521   /**
522    * Constructor.
523    * <p>
524    * Subclasses typically override the {@link #init(BeanStore)} method when using this constructor.
525    *
526    * @param beanStore The bean store containing injectable beans for this logger.
527    */
528   public CallLogger(BeanStore beanStore) {
529      Builder builder = init(beanStore);
530      this.logger = builder.logger;
531      this.thrownStore = builder.thrownStore;
532      this.normalRules = builder.normalRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.normalRules.size()]);
533      this.debugRules = builder.debugRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.debugRules.size()]);
534      this.enabled = builder.enabled;
535      this.enabledTest = builder.enabledTest;
536      this.requestDetail = builder.requestDetail;
537      this.responseDetail = builder.responseDetail;
538      this.level = builder.level;
539   }
540
541   /**
542    * Constructor.
543    *
544    * @param builder The builder for this logger.
545    */
546   public CallLogger(Builder builder) {
547      this.logger = builder.logger;
548      this.thrownStore = builder.thrownStore;
549      this.normalRules = builder.normalRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.normalRules.size()]);
550      this.debugRules = builder.debugRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.debugRules.size()]);
551      this.enabled = builder.enabled;
552      this.enabledTest = builder.enabledTest;
553      this.requestDetail = builder.requestDetail;
554      this.responseDetail = builder.responseDetail;
555      this.level = builder.level;
556   }
557
558   /**
559    * Initializer.
560    * <p>
561    * Subclasses should override this method to make modifications to the builder used to create this logger.
562    *
563    * @param beanStore The bean store containing injectable beans for this logger.
564    * @return A new builder object.
565    */
566   protected Builder init(BeanStore beanStore) {
567      return new Builder(beanStore)
568         .logger(beanStore.getBean(Logger.class).orElse(null))
569         .thrownStore(beanStore.getBean(ThrownStore.class).orElse(null));
570   }
571
572   /**
573    * Called at the end of a servlet request to log the request.
574    *
575    * @param req The servlet request.
576    * @param res The servlet response.
577    */
578   public void log(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
579
580      CallLoggerRule rule = getRule(req, res);
581
582      if (! isEnabled(rule, req))
583         return;
584
585      Level level = firstNonNull(rule.getLevel(), this.level);
586
587      if (level == Level.OFF)
588         return;
589
590      Throwable e = castOrNull(req.getAttribute("Exception"), Throwable.class);
591      Long execTime = castOrNull(req.getAttribute("ExecTime"), Long.class);
592
593      CallLoggingDetail reqd = firstNonNull(rule.getRequestDetail(), requestDetail);
594      CallLoggingDetail resd = firstNonNull(rule.getResponseDetail(), responseDetail);
595
596      String method = req.getMethod();
597      int status = res.getStatus();
598      String uri = req.getRequestURI();
599      byte[] reqContent = getRequestContent(req);
600      byte[] resContent = getResponseContent(req, res);
601
602      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
603
604      if (reqd != STATUS_LINE || resd != STATUS_LINE)
605         sb.append("\n=== HTTP Call (incoming) ======================================================\n");
606
607      ThrownStats sti = getThrownStats(e);
608
609      sb.append('[').append(status);
610
611      if (sti != null) {
612         int count = sti.getCount();
613         sb.append(',').append(StringUtils.toHex8(sti.getHash())).append('.').append(count);
614         if (count > 1)
615            e = null;
616      }
617
618      sb.append("] ");
619
620      sb.append("HTTP ").append(method).append(' ').append(uri);
621
622      if (reqd != STATUS_LINE || resd != STATUS_LINE) {
623
624         if (reqd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
625            String qs = req.getQueryString();
626            if (qs != null)
627               sb.append('?').append(qs);
628         }
629
630         if (reqContent != null && reqd.isOneOf(HEADER ,ENTITY))
631            sb.append("\n\tRequest length: ").append(reqContent.length).append(" bytes");
632
633         if (resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
634            sb.append("\n\tResponse code: ").append(status);
635
636         if (resContent != null && resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
637            sb.append("\n\tResponse length: ").append(resContent.length).append(" bytes");
638
639         if (execTime != null && resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
640            sb.append("\n\tExec time: ").append(execTime).append("ms");
641
642         if (reqd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
643            Enumeration<String> hh = req.getHeaderNames();
644            if (hh.hasMoreElements()) {
645               sb.append("\n---Request Headers---");
646               while (hh.hasMoreElements()) {
647                  String h = hh.nextElement();
648                  sb.append("\n\t").append(h).append(": ").append(req.getHeader(h));
649               }
650            }
651         }
652
653         if (resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
654            Collection<String> hh = res.getHeaderNames();
655            if (hh.size() > 0) {
656               sb.append("\n---Response Headers---");
657               for (String h : hh) {
658                  sb.append("\n\t").append(h).append(": ").append(res.getHeader(h));
659               }
660            }
661         }
662
663         if (reqContent != null && reqContent.length > 0 && reqd == ENTITY) {
664            try {
665               sb.append("\n---Request Content UTF-8---");
666               sb.append("\n").append(new String(reqContent, IOUtils.UTF8));
667               sb.append("\n---Request Content Hex---");
668               sb.append("\n").append(toSpacedHex(reqContent));
669            } catch (Exception e1) {
670               sb.append("\n").append(e1.getLocalizedMessage());
671            }
672         }
673
674         if (resContent != null && resContent.length > 0 && resd == ENTITY) {
675            try {
676               sb.append("\n---Response Content UTF-8---");
677               sb.append("\n").append(new String(resContent, IOUtils.UTF8));
678               sb.append("\n---Response Content Hex---");
679               sb.append("\n").append(toSpacedHex(resContent));
680            } catch (Exception e1) {
681               sb.append(e1.getLocalizedMessage());
682            }
683         }
684         sb.append("\n=== END ======================================================================");
685      }
686
687      if (rule.isLogStackTrace() && e == null)
688         e = new Throwable("Stacktrace");
689
690      log(level, sb.toString(), e);
691
692   }
693
694   /**
695    * Given the specified servlet request/response, find the rule that applies to it.
696    *
697    * <p>
698    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for finding rules.
699    *
700    * @param req The servlet request.
701    * @param res The servlet response.
702    * @return The applicable logging rule, or the default rule if not found.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
703    */
704   protected CallLoggerRule getRule(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
705      for (CallLoggerRule r : isDebug(req) ? debugRules : normalRules)
706         if (r.matches(req, res))
707            return r;
708      return DEFAULT_RULE;
709   }
710
711   /**
712    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled on this request.
713    *
714    * <p>
715    * Looks for the request attribute <js>"Debug"</js> to determine whether debug is enabled.
716    *
717    * <p>
718    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for determining whether debug mode is enabled on a request.
719    *
720    * @param req The HTTP request being logged.
721    * @return <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled on this request.
722    * @see org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#debugEnablement()
723    * @see Rest#debug()
724    * @see RestOp#debug()
725    */
726   protected boolean isDebug(HttpServletRequest req) {
727      return firstNonNull(castOrNull(req.getAttribute("Debug"), Boolean.class), false);
728   }
729
730   /**
731    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if logging is enabled for this request.
732    *
733    * <p>
734    * Uses the enabled and enabled-test settings on the matched rule and this logger to determine whether a REST
735    * call should be logged.
736    *
737    * <p>
738    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for determining whether a REST call should be logged.
739    *
740    * @param rule The first matching rule.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
741    * @param req The HTTP request.
742    * @return <jk>true</jk> if logging is enabled for this request.
743    */
744   protected boolean isEnabled(CallLoggerRule rule, HttpServletRequest req) {
745      Enablement enabled = firstNonNull(rule.getEnabled(), this.enabled);
746      Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest = firstNonNull(rule.getEnabledTest(), this.enabledTest);
747      return enabled.isEnabled(enabledTest.test(req));
748   }
749
750
751   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
752   // Other methods
753   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
754
755   /**
756    * Returns the logger to use for logging REST calls.
757    *
758    * <p>
759    * Returns the logger specified in the builder, or {@link Logger#getGlobal()} if it wasn't specified.
760    *
761    * <p>
762    * This method can be overridden in subclasses to provide a different logger.
763    *
764    * @return The logger to use for logging REST calls.
765    */
766   protected Logger getLogger() {
767      return logger;
768   }
769
770   /**
771    * Logs the specified message to the logger.
772    *
773    * <p>
774    * Subclasses can override this method to capture messages being sent to the logger and handle it differently.
775    *
776    * @param level The log level.
777    * @param msg The log message.
778    * @param e The exception.
779    */
780   protected void log(Level level, String msg, Throwable e) {
781      getLogger().log(level, msg, e);
782   }
783
784   private byte[] getRequestContent(HttpServletRequest req) {
785      if (req instanceof CachingHttpServletRequest)
786         return ((CachingHttpServletRequest)req).getContent();
787      return castOrNull(req.getAttribute("RequestContent"), byte[].class);
788   }
789
790   private byte[] getResponseContent(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
791      if (res instanceof CachingHttpServletResponse)
792         return ((CachingHttpServletResponse)res).getContent();
793      return castOrNull(req.getAttribute("ResponseContent"), byte[].class);
794   }
795
796   private ThrownStats getThrownStats(Throwable e) {
797      if (e == null || thrownStore == null)
798         return null;
799      return thrownStore.getStats(e).orElse(null);
800   }
801
802   @Override /* Object */
803   public String toString() {
804      return filteredMap()
805         .append("logger", logger)
806         .append("thrownStore", thrownStore)
807         .append("enabled", enabled)
808         .append("level", level)
809         .append("requestDetail", requestDetail)
810         .append("responseDetail", responseDetail)
811         .append("normalRules", normalRules.length == 0 ? null : normalRules)
812         .append("debugRules", debugRules.length == 0 ? null : debugRules)
813         .asReadableString();
814   }
815}
